alert.note: Alert for Tazewell (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 10 at 2:39PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Flood Advisory in Effect for Western Tazewell County Until 545 PM EDT... ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding resulting from repeated rainfall over saturated ground. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Virginia, including the following county, Tazewell. * WHEN...Until 545 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 237 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to showers and thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen in the advisory area within the past few hours. Additional rainfall of 1/2 to 1 inch is possible during the next couple of hours. Locally heavier rainfall is possible in isolated thunderstorms. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Beech Fork, Bluestone River, Big Creek, Clinch River, Deskin Creek, Dry Fork and Coal Creek. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Richlands... Tazewell... Cedar Bluff... Cliffield... Bandy... Claypool Hill... Amonate... - For additional information please visit our web site located at: http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood.
info.instruction: Precautionary/Preparedness Actions: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
